alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 5:39PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...South-central portions of the East Troublesome burn scar in Grand County, Colorado. This includes CO-125 between mile marker 13 and Highway 40. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 536 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Areas within the East Troublesome burn scar. - This includes the following additional locations... Middle Willow Creek Valley, Lower Willow Creek Valley and Drowsy Water Ranch.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
